solution_line_template: He needs {total_flour_needed} pounds of flour because {num_loaves} x {flour_per_loaf} = <<{num_loaves}*{flour_per_loaf}={total_flour_needed}>>{total_flour_needed}
He needs {ten_bags_needed} bags of 10 pound bags because {total_flour_needed} / {ten_pound_bag_size} = <<{total_flour_needed}/{ten_pound_bag_size}={ten_bags_needed}>>{ten_bags_needed}
He spends ${ten_bags_total_cost} if he buys this flour because {ten_bags_to_buy} x {ten_bag_price} = <<{ten_bags_to_buy}*{ten_bag_price}={ten_bags_total_cost}>>{ten_bags_total_cost}

He needs {twelve_bags_to_buy} bags of the 12-pound flour because {total_flour_needed} / {twelve_pound_bag_size} = <<{total_flour_needed}/{twelve_pound_bag_size}={twelve_bags_needed}>>{twelve_bags_needed}
He would spend ${twelve_bags_total_cost} on the 12-pound bags because {twelve_bags_to_buy} x {twelve_bag_price} = {twelve_bags_total_cost}
He spends ${ten_bags_total_cost} if he buys the cheapest flour because {ten_bags_total_cost} < {twelve_bags_total_cost}
